alert.note: Alert for Orange; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 7:08PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Seminole and central Orange Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 708 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lake Mary to Fern Park to Universal Studios. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Sanford, Apopka, Altamonte Springs, and Ocoee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
